titles: Master Geree's Case of conscience sifted Wherein is enquired, vvhether the King (considering his oath at coronation to protect the clergy and their priviledges) can with a safe conscience consent to the abrogation of episcopacy. By Edward Boughen. D.D.
Mr. Gerees Case of conscience sifted.
author: Boughen, Edward, 1587?-1660?
notes: An edition of: Boughen, Edward.  Mr. Gerees Case of conscience sifted.
A reply to: Geree, John.  A case of conscience resolved.
Reproduction of the original in the Congretional Library, London.
